lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.
1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE)
Adds a task with a deadline.
Adds an event task with start and end times.
Shows all tasks you have added.
Marks the given task as completed.
Marks the given task as **not done**.
Deletes the task from the list.
Searches for tasks that contain the keyword.
- Your tasks are automatically saved to a file (`data/bob.txt`).
- When you run Bob again, it will load your previous tasks.

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.
Bob is a simple task manager chatbot. You can add, list, mark, find, and delete tasks!
- **Todo** - a task to be done with no deadline
- **Deadline** - a task that has a deadline
- **Event** - a task that has a start and end time
Adds a task with a deadline.
Adds an event task with start and end times.
Shows all tasks you have added.
Marks the given task as completed.
Marks the given task as **not done**.
Deletes the task from the list.
Searches for tasks that contain the keyword.
- Your tasks are automatically saved to a file (`data/bob.txt`).
- When you run Bob again, it will load your previous tasks.

* Parses a deadline command string and constructs a {@code Deadline}

* @throws BobException if the description or deadline is missing

throw new BobException("Description of a deadline cannot be empty - Bob 😡");
